main event: A cylindrical, dark-colored object was observed circling in the southwest for over 10 minutes on 15-17 November 1958 in Loa, Utah.
interesting points: The observation was made using multiple types of surveillance including ground and air visuals., The object's path was circular and it left a contrail behind., The weather condition at the time was clear., The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes., The conclusion of the report suggested that the object could possibly be a balloon or an aircraft.
